\subsection{Detailed Description}
This class uses the \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1ISharedMemoryReader}{ISharedMemoryReader} 'library'/interface to read predictions and letter probabilities as computed by the P300 scenario from the shared memory

deletes the SharedVariableHandler. This has not much effect as it is the creating application that has to clean up the shared memory \hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1ExternalP300SharedMemoryReader_aada4721a8bb7d50de043057ca84b05d9}{

\end{DoxyParamCaption}

\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1ExternalP300SharedMemoryReader_aada4721a8bb7d50de043057ca84b05d9}
Simply constructs a SharedVariableHandler to provide access to all the variables in shared memory\par
 It is assumed that the first variable will be the stimulus (corresponding to the letter that is predicted by the P300 scenario) and the second variable could be the matrix with letter probabilities.\par
 So the shared memory writer box in the scenario should have at least a stimulation input and optionally a secondary streamed matrix input. \hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1ExternalP300SharedMemoryReader_ad7c8a544f8594bb2be25560b9ba85968}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::ExternalP300SharedMemoryReader@{OpenViBEApplications::ExternalP300SharedMemoryReader}!readNextPrediction@{readNextPrediction}}
